WorkItem.Description:
The WPF Data Grid has an IsSynchronizedWithCurrentItem property which, according to the documentation for the selector class:
 
‘You can set the IsSynchronizedWithCurrentItem property to true to ensure that the item selected always corresponds to the CurrentItem property in the ItemCollection. ‘
 
However, if the ItemCollection’s ‘CurrentChanged’ event handler sets the ‘Cancel’ property of the past event args to true, it appears the selected item can be changed by clicking on another row and does not stay in sync with the CollectionView’s CurrentItem.
 
Is this intended or is it a bug? If it is intended, is there any way to keep to two in sync always.
 
Regards,
 
Patrick
WorkItem.Summary: IsSynchronizedWithCurrentItem Bug When CurrentChanging is cancelled

Comments.Message: This is a WPF issue with Selector that is being tracked in our internal database.
A workaround using an attached property can be found here: http://coderelief.net/2011/11/07/fixing-issynchronizedwithcurrentitem-and-icollectionview-cancel-bug-with-an-attached-property/
